title: Love Actually set snaps of Hugh Grant give away more than you realised about Red Nose Day sequel
text:
Love Actually set snaps of Hugh Grant give away more than you realised about Red Nose Day sequel There were a few clues - and confirmations - in the Love Actually set snaps Share Get celebs   
Love Actually is back for a short - but sweet - sequel for Red Nose Day . 
We've already seen set snaps of Red Nose Day Actually thanks to Emma Freud, project director and wife to Richard Curtis , the man behind the original movie. 
At first glance the photos show Hugh Grant back in action, in No 10 Downing Street, but on closer inspection they reveal a few wonderful, and weird, facts about the upcoming sequel. 
We have a lot of questions and we're sure you do too so we've broken it down and gone all Nancy Drew on Love Actually. 
Here's a few hints of what was given away. They're married! 
Look! Emma Freud says the pic shows the PM, that Hugh, his wife and the writer, that's Richard Curtis. Wedding bells must've chimed at some point for the PM and his former secretary. Read More 37 Love Actually film secrets you probably didn't know Wait, why does he have a sling? 
Hmmm, the PM appears to have hurt himself. He's wearing a black sling. It can't be that serious - it's Red Nose Day. Hold up, how is he still PM? Hugh looking good as PM (Photo: emmafreud /Twitter) Read More The secret romance in Love Actually you'll have probably missed 
In the same tweet lovely Emma calls him the PM, but it's been aaaggggeees since Love Actually. A normal term for a PM has long been and gone. Does this mean our favourite PM has made a return in our time of need? Or he's been PM for something like 14 years? What a hero. 
What do you think? Martine somehow managing to not age at all (Photo: emmafreud/Twitter) Read More Emma Thompson talks about why she won't be back for Love Actually sequel and breaks all our hearts 
We'll soon find out, Richard Curtis speaking about the sequel said: "I would never have dreamt of writing a sequel to Love Actually , but I thought it might be fun to do ten minutes to see what everyone is now up to." 
As well as Hugh Grant and Martine McCutcheon, Keira Knightley, Liam Neeson and Colin Firth all returning as well as Andrew Lincoln among others. 
Now we're just worried he won't fit it all in. 
Emma Thompson won't be back, as she said she would fin it too hard without Alan Rickman. Red Nose Day Actually will be broadcast on 24 March 2017 on BBC One. 
Spotted any other hints of what's to come? Share your's in the comments below. Like us on Facebook
